page.title: 05EMERGENCY SERVICES(FIRE)
page.content: The Headquarters of the Cambridgeshire {Fire}and{Rescue}Service is situated in Hinchingbrooke Cottage.The Chief Fire Officer for the region has his work based here. The{Headquarters}provides employment for about 27 people,12 uniformed fire officers and 15 civilians.The main function of the place is to provide administrative files and records. It also prepares and reviews brigade policy and evaluates new ideas to see of they can be effecively used in the region's fire service. No emergency calls are put through to the Headquarters and no active fire engines are based at the cottage. The uniformed officers have their own individual jobs to carry out.Each of them are responsible for the upkeep of different aspects of the fire service.
